e4: While the current policy might seem advantageous in the short term, it is ultimately unsustainable and ethically questionable.  Adopting the new policy prioritizes honesty and transparency, building trust with investors and mitigating legal risks. Even if some investors initially misinterpret the change, clear communication and a commitment to accurate reporting will benefit ABC in the long run.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and completeness. It presents financial information in a clear and understandable way, without manipulation or intentional bias.  It adheres to accounting standards and regulations, and it openly communicates any changes in methodology or estimates. Even if short-term consequences seem negative, truthful reporting builds long-term trust with stakeholders and avoids legal repercussions.
e6: Yes, I would have several follow-up questions. First, how do we plan to communicate the policy change effectively to investors and minimize market disruption? Second, what strategies are in place to educate retail investors about the new reporting standard? Finally, what measures will be taken to ensure compliance with all relevant accounting standards and regulations during and after the transition?
